content.value: Mortefi, a skilled expert in Applied Tacetite Study and a member of the Academy’s Department of Safety, possesses the unique ability to transform his accumulated frustration into fiery flames. From a burning wrath that consumes all, the red dragon shall descend.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Mortefi is a 4-star Fusion Pistol wielding Hybrid that can dish out good damage when built correctly, but truly shines in a more Supportive role with teammates that primarily deal Heavy Attack damage. This is because his Ultimate Skill synergises with Heavy Attacks and his Outro amplies them by a further 38%.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Mortefi recharges his Forte Gauge with Basic Attacks, Resonance Skill and Intro Skill, which when full will convert his skill to Fury Fugue. This is similar to his Resonance Skill, being an excellent generator of Concerto Energy and Resonance Energy, with the addition of Fusion DMG in an AoE radius. His Forte Gauge can be quickly filled by using his Basic Attacks after Resonance Skill, unlocking Fury Fugue faster. Another great point of Fury Fugue is that it lacks any CD; it can be spammed indefinitely as long as your Forte Gauge fills up, and it doesn’t interfere with his normal Resonance Skill, allowing him to use the two in quick succession.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"His Resonance Skill generates a good amount of Concerto Energy and Resonance Energy while dealing Fusion Damage to his primary target.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"His Ultimate Skill deals Fusion Damage in front of him, generating a good chunk of Concerto Energy and buffing the entire team with Burning Rhapsody. While the buff is active, Mortefi will launch a coordinated attack when an enemy is hit by an ally, up to once every 0.35 seconds. If the landed attack is a Heavy Attack, he instead deals 2 coordinated attacks, doubling his potential damage output, making Heavy Attackers his ideal partners.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Mortefi requires minimal field time thanks to having one of the fastest and easiest to execute Concerto rotations in the game, which combines his excellent Outro buff, solid DPS and highly synergistic Ultimate Skill. He is also easy to play as his rotation is simple and fast to execute, making him a good choice for players of all skill. Even if you happen to mess up his rotation, it is quite easy to recover.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"While being able to deal good damage as far as Hybrid characters go, his true calling is being a Support thanks to his Outro Skill, hence he prefers the combination of 5P Moonlit Clouds and Impermanence Heron Echo. This stacks an additional 12% DMG and 22% ATK on top of his already potent 38% Heavy Attack amplification from Outro, generating a massive buff stack for the character switching in.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, Mortefi is currently one of the top Hybrid characters in endgame, especially for characters/teams centered around Heavy Attack burst rotation. Even if not for that, he sees use thanks to his incredibly fast Concerto Rotation and synergy with the 5P Moonlit Clouds and Impermanence Heron Echo. His strong Sequences can further increase his utility to your team.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredibly fast Concerto rotation allowing fast access to his Outro","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Incredible synergy with Heavy Attackers, boosting them and himself tremendously","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Good personal damage considering the suite of buffs he provides","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Insane Sequences that make him even stronger","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Easy to understand and play even at the highest level","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Strong enough to be played as a Hybrid even outside of his Heavy Attacker niche","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Long Ultimate cooldown - 20 seconds compared to 10 second duration of the buff - so you need to keep this in mind while doing your rotations","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"If you're stuck at S0, looking at the overpowered Sequences will make you feel bad","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

buildInfoWeapon.notes: Best gun in the game by a landslide, offering main stat CRIT RATE granting better crit ratios and as a result scaling, great base damage, and a good amount of Energe Regen (which saves you at least 1 sub-stat on gear). Also currently the only weapon in the game that offers any form of team-supportive ability granting the next character to switch in via intro an ATK boost synergizing immensely with the hybrid playstyle.

Usable gun by all Resonators offering good bonuses to ATK but reliant on dodging 3 times during your rotation for maximum value with continual dodges after that. Should only be used by those willing to perform dodges at the start of their rotation and consistently after. Calculations assume you perform dodges as soon as possible and maintain the buff.

One of the top gun options for Resonators that deals primarily Resonance Skill DMG with little to no conditions to worry about thanks to its effect being tied to Intro skills. Almost all characters make use of Intros in their rotation and the bonus lasts for 15 seconds - long enough for most Main DPS to finish their burst window making this a strong consistent option.

Generic gun option usable by all characters but with a significant ramp-up time on its bonus. Also requires the player not to be hit to extract full value. If you do get hit this weapon will fall behind (calculations assume you don't get hit even once).
Alternative gun option to Undying Flame for Resonance Skill focused damage characters, assuming they weave in several Basic Attacks in their rotation.

Easily accessible 3-star weapon that despite having lower base attack makes up for it with a high ATK% bonus at higher dupes. It does not have enough stats to compete with 4-star weapons but is a reasonable option if it's all you have. The only downside is that the buff only lasts 10 seconds, meaning it may fall off in the hands of a Main DPS character who takes up more field time.

A utility-focused weapon prioritizing lightning-fast Concerto rotations over raw output with the ability to transform entire units' action priorities under the right circumstances. Not always a good choice but when implemented correctly makes all the difference. Also offers an immense amount of Energy Regen further accelerating rotations and supportive capabilities.

An easily accessible supportive option with a reasonable amount of Energy Regen but also the unique ability to grant a sizable chunk of raw Resonance Energy once every 20 seconds. For most character rotations in teams, this bonus will be ready every time it's their turn to switch-in, making this weapon a great choice for any character who doesn't need damage but needs their Ultimate fast and has trouble accessing it otherwise. The flat energy gain is more powerful the less energy the character and team they are a part of can generate.

buildInfoOther.substats: Energy Regeneration (Until Breakpoint) >= CRIT RATE = CRIT DMG > ATK% > Flat ATK
